decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressive plays and quickly dealing damage to the opponent using a combination of low-cost creatures, direct damage spells, and pump effects. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Lightning Strike to control the battlefield. By maintaining pressure and quickly closing out games, this deck seeks to win the match before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy while controlling the board with removal spells and counter magic. The main goal is to maintain card advantage through draw spells like Memory Deluge and Deadly Cover-Up, while also removing threats with cards like Go for the Throat and Cut Down. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Chrome Host Seedshark and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal to close out the game. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and the ability to cast your spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on using a combination of powerful control cards and big creatures to dominate the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Leyline Binding and Spara's Headquarters to control the opponent's board, while also ramping up with cards like Herd Migration and Up the Beanstalk, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures like Archangel of Wrath and Topiary Stomper. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional support and resilience, making it difficult for the opponent to mount a successful offense.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures and combat tricks to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Knight-Errant of Eos and support cards like Resolute Reinforcements, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence. Cards like Gleeful Demolition and Case of the Gateway Express offer removal options, while Thran Portal and Warden of the Inner Sky provide card advantage. The deck's mana base includes both Mountains and Plains, along with utility lands like Eiganjo and Sokenzan for additional flexibility.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that provide card advantage and control options to outvalue opponents. It aims to maintain board control while generating card advantage through effects like Aftermath Analyst and Memory Deluge. Nissa, Resurgent Animist and Virtue of Strength provide additional value by generating tokens and buffing creatures. The deck also includes removal options like Vampires' Vengeance and Ill-Timed Explosion to deal with threats. The overall strategy is to control the game state, generate advantage, and overwhelm opponents with a combination of card advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with powerful creatures and spells. Additionally, the deck includes cards that provide card advantage and graveyard recursion to maintain resources in the long game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of threats and answers, utilizing a mix of creature-based and spell-based strategies to secure victory.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming your opponent with a swarm of creatures and aggression. Using cards like Skrelv's Hive and Venerated Rotpriest to generate tokens and pump them up, along with removal spells like Bring the Ending and Serum Snare to clear the way for your attacks. The deck also includes some control elements with Fading Hope and Annex Sentry to disrupt your opponent's plans. Overall, this deck is all about applying pressure early and maintaining tempo to secure a quick victory.
